We offer a unique space and a fresh Canadian perspective with unmatched cultural, musical and documentary programming. We do it in French, English and eight Aboriginal languages.
data.text:
Catherine Tait to Headline Content Canada 2024 Content Canada is proud to announce that Catherine Tait, President and CEO of CBC/Radio-Canada, will sit down for a wide-ranging main stage interview at Content Canada 2024 Tait will reflect on her six-year tenure at the helm of CBC/Radio-Canada since April 2018, and the challenges and opportunities facing media leaders and public broadcasters in Canada and around the world. Donâ€™t miss this important opportunity to hear from Tait about what comes next, and her thoughts on leadership and the future of the Canadian media industry. To register and secure your spot at this yearâ€™s event, please visit - https://shorturl.at/csEN2

Last night, I had the privilege of speaking at The Walrus Talks Canada's Creative Power in Ottawa for an inspiring event celebrating Canada's rich cultural institutions. Grateful for the opportunity to connect with such passionate individuals. In the photo: Suzanne GuÃ¨vremont, Government Film Commissioner and Chairperson, National Film Board of Canada Julie Roy, Executive Director and CEO, Telefilm Canada Nana aba Duncan, Carty Chair in Journalism, Diversity and Inclusion; Associate Professor, Carleton Universityâ€™s School of Journalism Valerie Creighton, President and CEO, Canada Media Fund | Fonds des mÃ©dias du Canada Leslie Weir, Librarian and Archivist of Canada, Library and Archives Canada | BibliothÃ¨que et Archives Canada Michelle Chawla, Director and CEO, Canada Council for the Arts | Conseil des arts du Canada Christopher Deacon, President and CEO, National Arts Centre | Centre national des Arts

We are partnering with the Canadian Association of Journalists to bring you this edition of Trust Talks, discussing the hardships and hopes of local news across our country. Piya Chattopadhyay, host of CBC Radio's The Sunday Magazine, speaks with Toronto Metropolitan University Professor April Lindgren, Juanita Taylor, Senior Reporter for CBC News Network, journalist and publisher Mohsin Abbas and Nicholas Hune-Brown, Executive Editor of The Local, about the vital role that local news plays, the challenges and rewards of telling local stories, and new ideas and strategies emerging to enhance local journalism.
